Detailed Description

A DoubleChromosome is made of an array of double values. Each value is in the range [lowerBound,upperBound[. The lower bound is include included, the upper bound not. Both the bounds are specified ad the instantiation time. DoubleChromosome is a fixed length chromosome class, thus number of genes is specified at instantiation time and cannot be modified after.

Version:
2.0
Since:
1.0

Member Function Documentation

final void jenes.chromosome.DoubleChromosome.average ( final DoubleChromosome  chromosome,
double  ratio 
)

Performs the weighted average between the genes in the two chromosomes. If ratio = 1, the chromosomes, do not change. If ratio = 0, chromosomes are swapped. The operation is performed until the end of shortest chromosome is reached.

Parameters:
chromosome - the chromosome to combine
ratio - the coefficient used in the weighted average

final void jenes.chromosome.DoubleChromosome.owa ( final DoubleChromosome  chromosome,
double  ratio 
)

Performs the ordered weighted average (OWA) between the genes in the two chromosomes. If ratio = 1, the second chromosome holds the maximal values, the first the minimal. The opposite in case of ratio = 0. The operation is performed until the end of shortest chromosome is reached.

Parameters:
chromosome - the chromosome to combine
ratio - the coefficient used in the weighted average
